executiveSummary: Daniel Wood and David Marinski presented their innovation, the Self-Balancing Unicycle (SBU), to the Sharks, seeking $300,000 for 10% equity. After demonstrating the product and discussing its technical details, patents, and sales performance, they secured a joint investment deal with two Sharks offering $300,000 for 33% equity.
keyDecisions: A deal was made with two Sharks for $300,000 in exchange for 33% equity.

actionItems.task: Finalize partnership and investment agreement with the Sharks.
Continue production of the first 100 SBU units and ensure quality assurance with the overseas factory.
Explore further licensing opportunities for proprietary electric vehicle controller technology.

nextSteps: Daniel and David will move forward with the Shark partnership, scale up production, and pursue additional licensing deals for their embedded controller technology.
